author: potuz
content: If you're planning to pre deposit your validators first, then better not advertise the fork version until you're done. That's how I sneaked in on pyrmont

author: protolambda
content: <@755590043632140352> we're likely pre-populating the state, without deposits, so there's no such thing as sneaking into the genesis state, even if you knew the contract address.

author: potuz
content: The contract address was kind of easy cause there aren't many goerli addresses continuously receiving 3M GoETH. The fork version was leaked from a github issue. Seems this time it will be impossible

author: ajsutton
content: I feel like we should spot you a genesis validator just for tradition. ðŸ™‚

author: protolambda
content: Haha, yea agreed, <@!755590043632140352> is always welcome in a testnet genesis set. Not sure what exact tranches of mnemonics Afri prepared, but you can get some keystores from us otherwise. After genesis it'll be public though, so goerli deposits will just work
